result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R Kriz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will complete Anger Management Classes.

Submit a DNA sample/pay surcharge

Pay Restitution and Court Costs

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Case settlement

Defendant Kevin R Kriz in court with attorney Kat Mcclain.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF150.  Agreement has been reached in these matters.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea in 14CF4 and to Ct's 2,3 with enhancers dismissed in 16CF150.  

14CF4-DE will enter a plea of NC.  Withhold sentence, one year probation, DE will attend anger management classes, CC, DNA sample/Surcharge, Rest of $2450.00

16CF150-DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 2 and G to Ct 3, enhancers dismissed.  Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommenations of the parties.   Withhold sentence, two years probation, CC, DNA sample/surcharge, anger management,
